<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class TestStringTokenizer {
```arduino
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
    File in = new File("ride.in");
    File out = new File("ride.out");
    String line;
    in.createNewFile();
    out.createNewFile();
    BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(in));
    PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(out)));
    while ((line = br.readLine()) != null) {
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(line);
        String firstToken = st.nextToken();
        String secondToken = st.nextToken();
        pw.println(firstToken + " " + secondToken);
    }
    pw.close();
}
```
}

<<<explanation>>>: In the given code, the `StringTokenizer` is initialized with the `line` variable, which is read from the input file. The `nextToken()` method is called twice to get the first and second tokens. The first token is assigned to the `firstToken` variable, and the second token is assigned to the `secondToken` variable. Finally, the `println()` method is used to write the first and second tokens separated by a space to the output file.

To assign `COMBO` to one token and `ADEFGA` to another token, you can modify the code as follows:
```arduino
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
    File in = new File("ride.in");
    File out = new File("ride.out");
    String line;
    in.createNewFile();
    out.createNewFile();
    BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(in));
    PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(out)));
    while ((line = br.readLine()) != null) {
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(line);
        String firstToken = st.nextToken();
        if (firstToken.equals("COMBO")) {
            // Do something with COMBO
        } else {
            String secondToken = st.nextToken();
            // Do something with ADEFGA
        }
        pw.println(firstToken + " " + secondToken);
    }
    pw.close();
}
```
In this modified code, the `if` statement checks whether the first token is equal to `"COMBO"`. If it is, then the code block inside the `if` statement is executed. Otherwise, the code block inside the `else` statement is executed. This way, you can handle the `COMBO` token differently from the `ADEFGA` token.
